instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00244: What is 820-00244? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1534: What is A1534? A1534 is a model number for a 12 inch size Macbook  from years 2015, 2016 with EMC 2746, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00045, 820-00244..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display and no backlight
threads.message:
Hi,
i got a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) that came with no backlight. When I opened it i saw that it was opened before and the lcd connector on the board was ripped off and backlight fuse was replaced.
So Replaced the lcd connector then i got an image but no backlight. 
After some measurements around <CHIP>U8401</CHIP> I suddenly don't get an image anymore but the system is still booting I already checked the LCD connector bit it looks soldered good.
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0S2</SIGNAL> is going up for a sec when plugging it in.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display and no backlight
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display and no backlight
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> pulses at same time?

I bet for bad contacts.
Did you try known good LCD assembly?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display and no backlight
threads.message:
unforunately <SIGNAL>DP_INT_HDP</SIGNAL> is not accessible (hidden behind cpu glue).

I resoldered the connector 2 times now and double checked the contact but i got the same result.
Unforunately i dont have a known good LCD for this model...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display and no backlight
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no display and no backlight
threads.message:
The signal comes from LCD; need to test with known good one.
Must go high at same time when 3V3/<SIGNAL>5V_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL> appear.
